title-group.article-title: GRADED MESH APPROXIMATION IN WEIGHTED SOBOLEV SPACES AND ELLIPTIC EQUATIONS IN 2D

abstract.p: We study the approximation properties of some general finite-element spaces constructed using improved graded meshes. In our results, either the approximating function or the function to be approximated (or both) are in a weighted Sobolev space. We consider also the Lp-version of these spaces. The finite-element spaces that we define are obtained from conformally invariant families of finite elements (no affine invariance is used), stressing the use of elements that lead to higher regularity finite-element spaces. We prove that for a suitable grading of the meshes, one obtains the usual optimal approximation results. We provide a construction of these spaces that does not lead to long, "skinny" triangles. Our results are then used to obtain L²-error estimates and hm-quasi-optimal rates of convergence for the FEM approximation of solutions of strongly elliptic interface/boundary value problems.
